sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Uniform Electronic Transactions in Dental Care Billing Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Uniform Electronic Transactions in Dental Care Billing Act.

sections.heading: Purpose.  The purpose of this Act is to standardize the forms used in the billing and reimbursement of dental care, reduce the number of forms used, increase efficiency in the reimbursement of dental care through standardization, and encourage the use of and prescribe a timetable for implementation
sections.text: Purpose. The purpose of this Act is to standardize the forms used in the billing and reimbursement of dental care, reduce the number of forms used, increase efficiency in the reimbursement of dental care through standardization, and encourage the use of and prescribe a timetable for implementation of electronic data interchange of dental care expenses and reimbursement.

sections.heading: Applicability.  Except as may be otherwise specifically provided, this Act applies to all dental plan carriers.
sections.text: Applicability. Except as may be otherwise specifically provided, this Act applies to all dental plan carriers.

sections.heading: Definitions.  As used in this Act:
sections.text: Definitions. As used in this Act:

sections.heading: Uniform electronic claims and eligibility transactions required.
sections.text: Uniform electronic claims and eligibility transactions required.

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
